climbs.name: Lowest Hanging Fruit
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, J. Cook, B. Scott

content.description:
This is the crag's namesake and the lowest hanging route in the canyon... for now, making it the closest Poudre route to FoCo... count it.

Move up towards the floating mini-dihedrals and great holds. Sort your beta before moving out the right side of an apex roof. More fun and bit of rad take you to the top.
content.location:
Either use the large boulder, stemming and caving your way to the first bolt

-or-

boulder off the deck towards first bolt and decent enough holds.

climbs.name: Heart of the Hummingbird
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, J. Cook, B. Scott

content.description: Heart of the Hummingbird is the finest specimen at the crag. It is a punchy little line that zips, requiring grace but also power. Leave a stance on a small slab, and climb towards the big ol' holds above. Get your heart beating 1,265 bpm, and squeak through the boulder problem that dangles you right at the apex of the upside-down pyramid. Climb through thoughtful face, and taste the sweet nectar.
content.protection:
Bolts and a b

olted anchor.
content.location: Start at a stance on a slab below the large upside-down pyramid.

climbs.name: Ground Control (The Titanic)
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, C. Gross, J. Snyder

content.description:
So the story goes...disaster is what brought the fate of this crag into existence. A boat rescue upstream closed the canyon, and with nowhere to go, Low Hanging Fruit Crag was discovered, sunken in the low depths of the canyon. On this destined day, the toprope "

Titanic

; was launched as one of the biggest and bestest rigs at the crag before later getting bolted, cleaned, and sent.

Despite saying "I'll never let go," some loose burgs of stone sent the FA team back to the ground before getting it under control and firing off this masterpiece that's more beauty than tragedy.

Great climbing on positive holds lead you up to a short overhanging section. Move through it and up fun face to easier climbing.
content.location:
It is on the Main Wall, left of the

Community Service

arete.

climbs.name: Generous Present
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, J. Cook

content.description:
Generous present - where everything and anything is possible, the present moment is all there is, when the familiar past and the predictable future (the known) no longer exist. New possibilities can only exist in the present moment....

...or maybe its just real good climbing up a steep overhang on holds that are far enough but good enough to grab your full undivided attention... take a picture to remember the moment, because this one is a gift.
content.location: Leave the ground on interesting terrain and tricky jugs. Head towards the overhanging panel above. Bust some moves through the volumes before a sting at the lip.

climbs.name: Community Service
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, J. Cook

content.description:
Community Service is another one for the people, by the people, for the betterment of fun. Start with fun, low angle but thoughtful climbing up the arete and across the slab before moving into the gunky funky roof encounter. Either dangle out the roof or stay stemmed before easy climbing to the top. This shares the same anchor as

Ground Control (The Titanic)

.

Grab a brush, and do some community service.
content.location: Start on the main arete where trail meets the wall with easy and technical moves off the ground.
